body.p: The undersigned would respectfully show that he became surety for John D Snowden, in bail bond for the appearanc of the latter in the circuit court of Clark county Which bond was forfeited at the last may term of said court & summons has been served on yr petitioner a short time since
The bond was executed in 1864, and at the time at which Snowden should have appeared the undersigned gave Snowden money to pay his expenses to Winchester -- so that he might enter in his appearance
Snowden left Danville where he was engaged at work for the undersigned with the view & under the promise to enter his appearance according to his bond.

After an absence of ten days or two weeks Snowden returned to the employment of the undersigned assuring that he had attended to the matter & had entered his appearance & all was right -- The undersigned knew no better until sum
mons. but fully confided in the statement of Snowden -- After remaining some time in Danville Snowden left & the undersigned does not know where he is --

If the undersigned had known the falsity of Snowdens statements -- he would have had him arrested But I had implicit confidence in his statements -- as he had been recommended to me as a strictly honorable & pious member of the church.

The undersigned is in limited circumstances & beginning a new business -- carding and weaving, and all his little means are necessary to succeed -- If he should have the amount of the bail bond is $500 ^to pay^ it would result in great disaster to him & a large family dependent on his exertions He respectfully prays for a remission of the said bond

Sworn to before me
J P Mitchell P J B C
The undersigned Know Mr Stephens & believe him to be a truthful and reliable man -- & concur in his petition

Joshua F Bell
J. P Mitchell
Fon. T. Fox
M T Chrisman
M J, Durham
Jona. B. Nichols

Clark Cir Ct
vs
Nelson Stephens
